title.narrative: Promoting Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGBV Survivors

description.narrative: Improved the well-being, social and economic empowerment and safety of women and girls (15+) who have been affected by conflict in Iraq, focusing on women at risk of and those who have survived Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV).
Internally displaced people (IDPs) and returnee, girls, men and boys, their families and communities in conflict-affected areas of Ninewa and Duhok governorates (Iraq).

Partners in the project: - Azidie Fraternity and Solidarity League (ASFL) for the first three months only. - Emma Organization for Human Development (EMMA)/ - People’s Development Organization (PDO). - Baghdad Women’s Association (BWA)

Strengthened civil society organizations are actively coordinating, protecting and promoting the rights and empowerment of conflict-affected women and girls. Conflict-affected women and girls who are survivors of SGBV receive quality case management, MHPSS services and reintegration support. Conflict-affected women and girls (15+)report improved rights awareness, life skills and confidence.
Activity is being implemented in Duhok governorate, covering IDPs inside camps and host communities.

activity-description.narrative: Improved wellbeing, social and economic empowerment and safety of women and girls (15 years and older) who have been affected by conflict in Iraq, focusing on women at risk of and those who have survived sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV)

description.narrative: Humanitarian Aid / Protection

provider-org.narrative: Grant From the Stabilization and Humanitarian Aid Department

title.narrative: 1211- Sensitive outreach and community mobilization for the promotion of project services is carried out with conflict-affected women and girls, men and boys (15+) in the four operational areas.

description.narrative: At the inception of the community centers’ work, activities focused on providing outreach/community mobilization awareness on the project services, as well as the available activity opportunities through individual household visits or group sessions in public or private places. The volunteers of all four partners are conducting sensitive outreach for the purpose of promotion of project services using brochures, home visits and meeting with groups of people in schools, hospitals, cultural centers, and visiting other service providers.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of conflict-affected women, men, boys, girls to receive sensitive outreach for the promotion of project services
1410 Targeted communities/ beneficiaries took necessary protective measures to contain COVID-19.

description.narrative: Beneficiaries needed knowledge and urgent assistance to take protective measures at the start of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, but many sites and social media outlets were publishing false information, leaving communities feeling helpless and unaware of the proper steps to take. This is when NPA and partners focused on delivering accurate information about the COVID-19 pandemic to beneficiaries, so that they could protect themselves and their families. Protective efforts have recently focused on providing accurate information regarding COVID-19 vaccinations and encouraging communities to get vaccinated.

title.narrative: Online Dashboard

description.narrative: Since the beginning of the pandemic, NPA and partners have recognized the importance of raising COVID-19 awareness and encouraging communities, particularly women, to take protective measures. As a result, many awareness raising sessions and meetings have been held to increase beneficiaries' knowledge of COVID-19. Since the beginning of June 2021, these seminars and discussions have focused on disseminating accurate vaccine information and encouraging women to get vaccinated.

title.narrative: % of total project budget dedicated to respond to corona virus crisis

description.narrative: the budget was mostly used to respond to immediate needs of women and girls providing them with food baskets and hygiene kits.

actual.value: 2% from total budget of PDO (4 years) 0.37% from total project budget (4 years) 15,970 USD /PDO

title.narrative: 1110-CSO partners have improved their organizational capacity (e.g., project, human resources, procurement and financial management).

description.narrative: Building the competencies of CSO partners has been one of NPA's key priorities since the beginning of the project, and this has been accomplished through continuous trainings and coaching. NPA saw a significant growth in partners capabilities, not just among project workers but also among staff from CSO headquarters.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA Baseline assessment report
Number of CSO partners that have demonstrated improved HR and planning capacity, ranking ‘satisfactory ‘in a capacity assessment report card.

description.narrative: Scoring is done focusing in partners HR and procurement systems and the improvements they achieved.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners that have demonstrated improved financial management capacity, ranking ‘satisfactory’ in a capacity assessment report card.

description.narrative: Scoring is done focusing in partners financial system and the improvements they achieved.

title.narrative: 1210- Conflict-affected women and girls (15+) are accessing confidential and quality case management and referral to services (e.g., medical, legal, education, livelihoods, etc.).

description.narrative: Case Management services are defined here as complete services offered as needed to vulnerable women and girls aged +15 who have been recognized as SGBV survivors. Although many women and girls still do not report the violence they see for a variety of reasons, those who do report receive complete assistance that begin with them providing informed consent and end with case closure while keeping the survivor centered approach in mind.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report
Percentage of cases receiving referrals that have received a follow up call within one week after referral.
Number of women and girls 15+ to receive case management services

description.narrative: During 2020, face-to-face case management was replaced with online and phone case management, which was difficult for survivors and social workers alike, but it allowed us to ensure that the S/GBV survivors' conditions would not worsen and that we could instead support them. This continuance of case management fostered confidence between CSOs and survivors since survivors believed they had not been forgotten and that we still cared for them. After the lockdown ended, face-to-face case management resumed and it was still ongoing in 2021. After the lockdown ended, face-to-face case management resumed and it was.

title.narrative: Percentage of cases receiving referrals to specialized services (medical, child protection, legal, education, livelihood etc).

description.narrative: Case management provides the beneficiaries with referral services and help them connect with external medical, legal and other relevant public services. Project efforts focus on providing wrap-around case management services for women and girls, including SGBV survivors, to address some of the most commonly needed services, as PSS including life skills and recreational activities, emotional aid and trauma counselling, coverage of medical costs, referral/escorts for medical care, legal services, and socio-economic programming.

title.narrative: Number of women and girls receiving simple needs services

description.narrative: Simple needs services are especially important for the case management process, Women's needs are a reflection of their mental health, women who couldn't access food, hygiene, or any other needs during COVID-19 were suffering more, and having this line in the project's budget allowed NPA and partners to help the women in need while also building trust between survivors and social workers. Survivors' need for basic necessities remains critical. As the economic crisis ravages Iraq, IDPs suffer the most, and providing these necessities is sometimes a life saver for them.

title.narrative: 1200- Conflict-affected women and girls (15+) who are survivors of SGBV receive quality case management services, reintegration support and protection for life-threatening cases of SGBV.

description.narrative: Case management it is a lengthy service provision, it can last a minimum of two months up to two years. The duration of the service is based on the requirements or needs of the survivor. Women and girls are constantly encouraged to participate in psychosocial and reintegration programs as a method of empowering SGBV survivors, in particular and women in general.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report

% clients who rank their overall satisfaction with the quality of SGBV case management services as 4 or 5 out of 5. (confidential, respectful, supportive, helpful advice, referral access, timely follow-up).
1000- Improved wellbeing and empowerment of conflict-affected women and girls (15+) with particular focus to SGBV survivors in Iraq and KRI

description.narrative: Changes in the well-being status of conflict affected women and girls (15+) depend on a set of factors, such as their current health status and whether they experience any relevant psychological disorders, how far they have control over their lives, their perceptions of safety, and prevalence of SGBV in their communities.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report
Women, girls, men and boys 15+ approve of women and adolescent girls' participation in public life and decision-making.

comment.narrative: The baseline and endline results will be measured by the end of project to report this indicator as impact of the project

title.narrative: Improved well-being of conflict-affected women and girls 15+ who report reduced trauma symptoms (anxiety, desperation, fear etc.) by the end of the project period.

comment.narrative: The difference between baseline and endline values will be measured by end of the project to report this indicator

title.narrative: 1413 NPA partners quickly and efficiently responded to COVID-19 pandemic.

description.narrative: Due to COVID-19 pandemic many families and individuals found themselves lacking basic needs, such as food and hygiene items. NPA and partners found that it is essential given the situation to provide these urgent needs to IDPs (especially those who are living outside camps since they don’t receive food rations or other food assistance from NGOs). A new budget line for COVID-19 response was created to cover food assistance and the provision of hygiene kits. Partners’ staff carried out vulnerability assessments for all beneficiaries, identifying in-kind assistance for those in more urgent need. This service was provided in 2020.

title.narrative: Online Document
# of families and individuals received food baskets

description.narrative: Food assistance distribution. NPA and partners targeted families that became vulnerable and lost their livelihoods because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.narrative: # of individuals received hygiene kits

description.narrative: the hygiene kits were distributed mostly for non-camp IDPs who were in a vulnerable situation due to pandemic but were not targeted by other NGOs providing NFIs.

title.narrative: # of food baskets distributed
1123- ToT on Orienting Local Activity Leaders/volunteers (e.g., Code of Conduct, GBV Core Concepts, Effective PSS Sessions, and Trauma-Sensitivity) is held for staff from the three CSO partners.

description.narrative: During 2020 NPA was able to train partners on GBV core concept, Counselling, Trauma Sensitivity, Facilitation Techniques, Safety Audit, Outreach and Communication with Community, PSS, Advocacy, GBVIMS, etc. NPA focused especially in BWA as it is a new partner. Due time constrains instead of NPA training volunteers, the partners' staff started training them.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Completion of TOT on Orienting Local Activity Leaders. (training conducted)
1130- CSO partners advocate more effectively for women's rights based on their own strategy for promoting women’s rights.

description.narrative: During many discussions with beneficiaries during the project's preparation phase, we discovered that Yazidi women and girls are very frustrated by the way they are kept in the dark about advocacy initiatives and events; many of them complained that they are not involved as needed and that other people come along and represent them when they can come forward and speak for themselves with a little additional assistance from NGOs; this is why, for this project, NPA and partners agreed that the topic for advocacy will be grass-root advocacy.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report
Number of CSO partners that have Women's Rights Advocacy Action plans.

description.narrative: NPA had meetings with the three CSO partners to discuss about grass root advocacy and masculinity program, the partners started working on preparing and developing their plans. now that they have a plan put in place partners are now giving sessions of advocacy in camps and non-camp areas.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partner that have at least 4 staff members/volunteer trained to deliver awareness-raising sessions on women's rights.

description.narrative: The CSO partners have staff and volunteers trained to deliver sessions on women’s rights and psychosocial support for women, girls, men and boys.

title.narrative: 1120- CSO partners have improved capacity to deliver quality SGBV case management to conflict-affected women girls, and quality awareness sessions, PSS to women, men, girls and boys (15+).

description.narrative: Every year, NPA gives a package of trainings to partners to ensure that their abilities are improved, but also to refresh their learning on SGBV subjects which they have previously being trained on. These trainings also benefit partners in the event of staff turnovers since skill enhancement ensures that there is always trained personnel available to give orientation to new staff.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA Baseline assessment report
Number of CSO partners who have 2 staff members available to provide orientation training to new local activity leaders.

description.narrative: All three partners' staff members have been trained and have received sufficient knowledge to provide orientation to new staff; however, this task is typically managed by the team leaders and project managers; if one of them is absent or on leave, one of the social workers assists in providing orientation to new staff.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners who have at least 3 staff/volunteers who can lead life skill sessions for adolescent girls.

description.narrative: The partners’ staff are trained on facilitating sessions for beneficiaries including adolescent girls.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners with confidential case management documentation systems ranking ‘good’.

description.narrative: The partners are adhering to Iraq's standardized GBV information management system, which includes guidelines for maintaining the confidentiality of the documents. They have indeed received adequate training and have lockable drawers as well as secure digital filing.

title.narrative: 1234.1- SGBV survivors set up sustainable micro-enterprises

description.narrative: In 2021 and 2022, four livelihood officers were select and hired to train women and girls in business skills and business management. The selected women and girls will then propose their entrepreneurship ideas and with the assistance of the livelihood officers will prepare an implementation plan. The partners will provide them with the needed materials for their micro businesses. In 2021, the livelihood officers trained more than 100 women and girls in the three operational areas. The same process is applied currently to train another 100 women and girls.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
# of SGBV survivors received micro-enterprise

description.narrative: 125 women and girls got assistance in starting their own businesses; following up after each business was an important element of the activity to guarantee the continuity and sustainability of each business; and nearly all businesses of 2021 were still functioning as of the end of the first quarter of 2022. During the first quarter 13 women and girls received assistance to start their businesses, the remaining 87 women and girls will be selected and receive the assistance during the second quarter of 2022.

title.narrative: 1221- Safe alternative accommodation (max. 10 months) and rehabilitation services are provided to SGBV survivors unable to return to family and/or facing physical threats in the four operational areas.

description.narrative: In Duhok, there is just one safe shelter, which is both neglected and overcrowded. In many respects, the shelter falls short. Despite the fact that the shelter is controlled by the government, due to the current economic crisis the shelter does not get adequate funding and depends in the NGOs support. Despite the fact that NGOs are continually campaigning for it, there is currently no safe shelter for women who have been victims to violence in Mosul (Ninewa Governorate).

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of clients who disclose a life-threat or who are unable to return to families to receive safe alternative accommodation.

description.narrative: Unfortunately, because of the conditions of the safe shelter in Duhok and the lack of a safe shelter in Mosul, all survivors opted not to go to safe shelters and instead made other arrangements, such as staying with a relative or a family member.

title.narrative: 1132- Awareness-raising sessions guidelines are developed on topics relating to gender social norm change for CSOs partners working in the four operational areas.

description.narrative: NPA and partners have developed materials and printed them for the awareness raising sessions. It is worth noting that the sessions focus on topics that communities need to be more aware of, such as women's rights, gender equality, and the elimination of harmful norms that limit women's freedom and well-being.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Awareness Raising Session Guidelines for gender social norm change

description.narrative: NPA and CSO partners have developed materials and printed them for the awareness raising sessions. It is worth noting that the sessions focus on topics that communities need to be more aware of, such as women's rights, gender equality, and eliminating harmful norms that limit women's freedom and well-being.

title.narrative: 1131- Partner CSOs hold coordination meetings and present their joint advocacy agenda and plan for the advancement of women's rights as per their own mandate.

description.narrative: NPA and partners have developed materials and printed them for the awareness raising sessions. It is worth noting that the sessions focus on topics that communities need to be more aware of, such as women's rights, gender equality, and the elimination of harmful norms that limit women's freedom and well-being. At the start of 2020, NPA and partners met and agreed to focus on grass-roots advocacy as the major issue for advocacy. NPA and partners produced an advocacy curriculum and plan, however due to COVID-19, the plan had to be put on hold as other priorities arose. The debates and execution of grass-roots advocacy continued at the end of 2020. NPA received many positive feedbacks from participants in these events in 2021, particularly from ISIL survivors who were highly interested in this issue and continuously requested for more of these activities.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of Women’s rights advocacy planning partner meetings/workshops

description.narrative: NPA had meetings with the three partners to discuss about grass root advocacy and put a plan on how to implement the advocacy in targeted areas.

title.narrative: 1 year Joint partner Advocacy Strategy and Monitoring Framework

1300- Conflict-affected women and girls (15+) are better able to understand and access their rights to participate in psychosocial, recreational, economic empowerment, educational, family and community decision-making processes.

description.narrative: NPA and partners reach out to women and girls in the community, through outreach and awareness activities, to urge them to take an active role in their families and communities. But also to help them gain more self-confidence to speak up in their families and communities.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA Baseline report
% women and girls 15+ report that they would feel confident speaking up in family and community meetings/dialogue.

description.narrative: NPA and partners noted that women are still suppressed from trying to express their feelings and thoughts in family and community dialogues, fearing that their opinions will be belittled or yelled at by male family members. Since the beginning of NPA's work in protection, the scope of NPA's work was to give women enough confidence to speak up and have enough self-confidence to represent themselves and accept themselves. While some of our beneficiaries strengthened their self-esteem in 2020, allowing them to speak out and demand their rights, we have seen women and girls take a more active part in advocating their rights and developing their own networks of support in 2021. This year more and more women are proposing ideas to start their advocacy initiatives and partners are planning to support them whenever needed, with that been said we are still receiving many cases of domestic violence which indicates that we still need to cover more areas and expand our services to have more women participate in empowering activities.

title.narrative: 1111- Continuous training and coaching on project planning and management is provided for the three CSO.

description.narrative: NPA held an inception workshop for three CSO partners in December 2019 to discuss the aims and plans of the new project and what parts need to be prioritized. Another orientation training was held for the project's new partner (BWA) on the responsibilities and regulations of NPAs, partnership systems, financial systems, compliance, and Code of Conduct. NPA partners attended a project management professional program in February 2021. Since then, the CSO partners have received monthly guidance and mentoring via meetings and field visits.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of training and individualized coaching sessions for CSO partners on project management.
Number of partners to receive training on project management

1121- Intensive and ongoing training and coaching on GBV Core Concepts, Safety Audits, Outreach, Case Management, PSS, Life-Skills, Self-Care, etc. is provided to the three CSOs operational in the four areas.

description.narrative: NPA hired a consultant who provided intensive trainings on GBV core concept, GBV case management, PSS, trauma sensitivity, outreach, safety audit, counselling, PSEA and selfcare among other topics. The trainings took place in April and May 2021 and it lasted 15 working days. For 2022 NPA hired a trainer with a specific focus on providing an extensive training for five days on mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS) as one of the most needed services are MHPSS services but it is also one of the needs that lacks in most of the areas thus it was important to provide a training to social workers so that they would be more aware on what cases they can handle by themselves and what cases they can refer to ensure proper services are provided to survivors and the concept of Do No Harm has been applied throughout the case management process.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of individualized coaching sessions on outreach and case management for CSO partners

description.narrative: Every month, NPA staff conducts several coaching sessions with partners via field visits, meetings, online sessions, and phone calls. Coaching is critical to ensuring that partners have gained information about many elements of their job, particularly work connected to communicating with beficairies, such as outreach and case management.

title.narrative: Number of core trainings delivered to Mobile Teams

description.narrative: on 2020 Trainings on GBV Concept, Safety Audit, GBVIMS, Psychosocial support for S/GBV survivors and Case Management were delivered to CSO partners and then follow up was made to make sure partners are implementing what they have learnt. the same trainings and more were provided to CSO partners' staff by a consultant hired by NPA during April and May of 2021.

title.narrative: 1133- Training on Delivering Awareness Raising Sessions is provided to CSO partners in the four operational areas.

description.narrative: NPA trains and coaches partners' staff and volunteers on facilitation skills while giving awareness sessions. In April and May 2021, partners were trained by an external consultant on a variety of themes (GBV core concept, Counselling, Trauma Sensitivity, Facilitation Techniques, Safety Audit, Outreach and Communication with Community, PSS, Advocacy, and GBVIMS), including awareness raising implementation.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of CSO partner staff /volunteer activity leaders to complete the Awareness Raising training.

description.narrative: During 2021, staff and volunteers who received training from NPA went on to deliver the same trainings to other staff who were unable to participate due to different reasons. This strategy proved to be extremely useful as staff and volunteers of partners were more confident to share their knowledge and focus on developing their expertise. It also developed a support structure as volunteers understood who would be their focal point for each particular subject.

title.narrative: 1113- Human resources training and ongoing recruitment support is provided to the three CSO partners.

description.narrative: NPA's HR manager completed an HR evaluation for all partners in the latter months of 2021. A capacity building plan has been designed for them for the year 2022.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of partners to receive Human Resources training.
Number of CSOs Recruitment Days co-facilitated by NPA.

1232- Recreational and life skills activities are held for women and girls (15+), and recreational activities are held for their male family members and other males (15+) who reside in the four operational areas.

description.narrative: PSS sessions are a key supportive component of the Case Management action planning aspect and are intended to provide psychosocial relief and recreational opportunities particularly for the SGBV survivors in order to strengthen their psychosocial well-being through recreation and learning life skills. They are also used as a platform for gaining access to the vulnerable women and girls in the targeted areas and accessing SGBV survivors and victims in a safe and comfortable environment where the participants could be motivated to talk about personal experiences. The activity also supports identifying potential SGBV cases in the communities, in addition to develop support social networks between women/girls themselves who critically lack meeting spaces where they could talk and spend time together. Recreational activities are provided for men, youth and children. This activity was used to generate community acceptance and support for the project services avoiding stigmatization of the places and services women.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of women and girls receiving vocational training

description.narrative: Vocational trainings are highly requested activities by beneficiaries as they find them opportunity to learn a new skill which might help them build a livelihood or find a job or at least use this skill to make it as a phycological relief and distraction during hardships, we have also noticed that women who have built their skills in a specific field, feel more self-worth and this boosts their self-confidence

title.narrative: Average number of men and boys 15+ participating in recreational activities each month

description.narrative: Same as women, PSS activities are provided to men as well, with more focus on positive and negative masculinity concepts, and how the negative ones impacts the suppression of women's rights and limits men's freedom of becoming themselves. The activities were on going but they were following the instructions from ministry of health to not have gatherings of more than six to eight people.

title.narrative: Number of women and girls 15+ participating in recreational & life skills activities

description.narrative: Th main topic for the PSS activities for women and girls are advocacy but based on the needs other activities might be organized such as activities in days of (Women International Day, 16 Days of Activism, etc.) also providing peer support sessions to survivors of genocide in camps.

title.narrative: 1233- Business skills and management training and follow-up mentoring sessions are held for SGBV survivors

description.narrative: Prior the implementation of the business skills and business management, NPA trained the four livelihood officers to ensure a high-quality training. In order to do so, NPA hired a consultant who trained the livelihood officers of the three partners for five days. The consultant designed the training course tools and presentations for the livelihood officers about business skills and management. This capacity building effort also included the coaching and mentoring of the livelihood officers. Once received the training, the four livelihood officers trained the women and girls who were selected for receiving small business assistance.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
# of SGBV survivors attended business skills and management training sessions

description.narrative: The trainings covered a wide range of subjects that survivors can use to launch their own businesses, including (Market Assessment, Marketing, budgeting, preparing workplans, etc.).During the first quarter of the year 2022 Emma was able to train 25 women and girls and provide them with necessary items to start their businesses, the rest of the trainings will be conducted in the second quarter by all partners.

title.narrative: 1213- Confidential referrals to specialized service providers (medical, psychiatric, legal, child protection, education, livelihoods, etc.) are provided to conflict-affected women and girls (15+) in the four operational areas.

description.narrative: Prior to refer survivors, the partners conducted a service mapping with special emphasis on the services that the survivors might need. Duet to the COVID-19 pandemic, in 2020 most partners focused on enhancing their collaboration with NGOs that provide COVID-19 relief assistance. This collaboration continued in 2021 as there are still many women in need of basic food, hygiene, and health services. In 2021 one of the most needed services in Mosul was the provision of legal assistance to issue legal documentation for women and children, as many have lost it or did not issue any documents during ISIL control over Mosul. Access to documents is a key intervention in social and legal protection and assistance projects for displaced persons, as it mitigates the risk of detention and refoulment and allows access to essential services, such as education. Referrals were made with the survivors' consent

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
% of clients who received a referral
% referrals followed up by social workers.
1320- Conflict-affected women and girls (15+) demonstrate improved rights awareness, life skills and confidence.

description.narrative: Since the beginning of the project in December 2019, NPA and partners have had several meetings to determine the most successful activities for boosting women's confidence, increasing their understanding of their rights and increase their participation in family and community settings.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report

% of female participants active in over 6 life skills sessions and 6 recreational activities report improved confidence in family dialogue, decision making, voicing their opinion in the family and community.

description.narrative: Women and girls are becoming more interested in participating in life skills sessions, according to NPA and partners. Women and girls wanted to increase their self-esteem and be powerful enough to speak up about their rights, capabilities, and willingness to change their communities.

title.narrative: % of awareness raising female participants report having basic knowledge of women’s rights, harmful social norms and SGBV

description.narrative: The activities especially (Psychosocial support and General Awareness Raising Sessions) are aimed to familiarize women with their rights and promote women’s rights and equality as well as build self-confidence and self-esteem of women

title.narrative: 1230-Conflict-affected women and girls (15+) and their families access quality psychosocial and reintegration activities.

description.narrative: The Psychosocial Support (PSS) activities aim to increase women's awareness and comprehension of their rights, to teach women and girls how to advocate for their rights and needs, and to enable them to continue advocating for it long after the PSS activities have ended.

title.narrative: 2020 NPA baseline assessment report
% of outreached women and girls, 15+ attending psychosocial and reintegration activities

description.narrative: Aside from CM services, CSO partners provide PSS (recreational, fun, therapeutic, outdoor activities, life skills) programs to assist vulnerable women and girls, particularly case management beneficiaries, in overcoming traumatic or difficult situations.

title.narrative: % of women and girls 15+ who regularly (more than 3 times) participated in a recreational, life skill activity.

description.narrative: Many women after participating in one activity opt to participate in more than one activity, as they feel that the centers are safe places for them to express themselves without been judged or been belittled, they also see their participation or visiting the center as the only recreational activity they do for themselves, as they are limited on where to go or what to do dur their family responsibilities but also due their families not allowing them to go out most of the times.

title.narrative: 1234.2-Agricultural Training hold for SGBV survivors

description.narrative: The activity was designed by NPA partner PDO. The objective was to enable women who have experienced GBV and are interested in farming improve their expertise and establish their own income-generating initiatives. The activity took place in Khanke District (Dohuk Governorate), which is abundant in agricultural fields. For the year 2022, PDO set in place some plastic houses for women and girls to use as agricultural land to avoid the challenges they faced previously due to drought season, as plastic houses need less water and are not affected by extreme weather.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
# of SGBV survivors attended Agricultural training sessions

description.narrative: A group of 16 Yazidi women were trained by an agricultural specialist on a variety of issues, including ((How to identify environmentally sustainable plants, seeding, harvesting, watering systems, and sell products).

title.narrative: 1321- Awareness-raising sessions are held on harmful social norms, gender norms and women's rights for women, girls, men and boys (15+) in three operational areas.

description.narrative: The community awareness sessions cover themes that are more relevant to the context of the targeted areas, such as women's rights and preventing violence against women. Partners are incorporating to this project the lessons learned from previous project, especially regarding the most effective ways to deliver awareness raising sessions. In January 2021, partners conducted a baseline survey, to support the selection of the awareness sessions topics. Partners planned to deliver activities that reflect common issues that women face in their community, and ensure conflict affected women are able to better understand and access their rights to participate in psychosocial, recreational, economic, educational, family, and community decision-making processes. In December 2021 NPA and partners had a meeting to discuss about the most common protection concerns and what topics can be covered through awareness sessions, the topics that were mostly discussed were (domestic abuse, reproductive health, lack of information about health, MHPSS, online sexual harassment and bullying, etc.).

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of beneficiaries to attend awareness-raising sessions.

description.narrative: CSO partners delivered activities online during the lockdown in 2020, but once it ended, they began delivering activities on the ground instead of online. Women and girls were pleased to see this change, particularly because not everyone had internet access, so they were happy to participate in activities face to face and discuss topics that were important to them. All activities are now conducted face to face, however in certain months, such as August, when COVID cases and deaths rose, partners were forced to postpone activities and then restart them in September.

title.narrative: % of beneficiaries who report the session was “very useful” in an exit survey

description.narrative: CSO partners ensure that all participants have the opportunity to speak and express their opinions during any activity. We also ensure that all questions posed by participants are answered correctly, and that women leave the sessions with enough knowledge and awareness to help them in their daily lives.

title.narrative: Number of awareness raising sessions completed

description.narrative: The awareness-raising sessions are mostly about domestic violence, women’s rights, reproductive health, family planning, protection from sexual exploitation, maintaining physical and mental health during COVID-19 times. while COVID lockdown itself didn't last for a very long time however its effects are noticeable till now, one of the main effect was the increase of domestic violence and early marriage. the sessions are still ongoing following the instructions from directorate of health to ensure the safety of staff and participants from Covid-19. during August and due to increase of COVID-19 cases partners had to postpone some activities and resume them once again in September, this situation keeps happening where in some months COVID cases increase and the health directorate advices NGOs to minimize gatherings.

title.narrative: 1212-Confidential case management is provided for interested conflict-affected women and girls (15+) who are residing in the three operational areas.

description.narrative: The high level of confidence and trust building between the partners case managers and the SGBV and trauma survivors, encouraged the latter to declare their situation and accept the potential social recognition and stigma that may arise from accessing different services. Maintaining confidentially of SGBV cases was an issue of high importance, which was always strengthened through proper documentation process and filing systems, following sensitive information, disclosure policy and the different partners Code-of-Conduct stipulations. In certain areas or circumstances, gender specific considerations were made to allow free and comfortable participation. For example, conducting separate awareness sessions for women/girls or men/boys, as needed. In addition, the media coverage of the project activities was minimized to prevent public disclosure of the participants.

title.narrative: Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
% of women and girls 15+ to receive follow-up sessions after intake assessment. % of clients who possess an action plan.

description.narrative: All SGBV survivors that have given their consent receive follow-up sessions by the social workers, follow-up sessions are part of case management process to ensure the survivor’s wellbeing is improved and to meet her needs bases on case by case.

title.narrative: % of clients who possess an action plan

description.narrative: 100% of the survivors have action plan, the action plan is done by taking into consideration the concepts of survivor centered approach and do no harm, also the social workers together with the survivors work on preparing the action plan.

title.narrative: 1310- Conflict-affected women, girls, men and boys (15+) demonstrate more gender-equitable attitudes

description.narrative: Through this project, NPA and its partners seek to transform detrimental attitudes toward women's rights and promote gender equality. The primary objective of these activities is not only to provide a service, but also to provide a space for community members, which include women, men, girls, and boys, to reflect on their attitudes and to consider gender equality as a natural part of life that should exist in society. As a result, these community members collaborate to achieve gender equality.

title.narrative: NPA baseline assessment report
% of women, men, girls and boys 15+ who demonstrate an improved Gender Equality Indicator score.

description.narrative: NPA and partners saw a number of positive shifts in community views about women's rights, including a growth in the number of women and girls working outside their homes, as well as more women driving automobiles in Mosul, an act that was once considered taboo for women. Although males have become more receptive of women's rights, other types of GBV have developed, such as early marriage and domestic violence, with domestic violence accounting for more than half of all receiving cases in 2020. The majority of GBV incidents documented in 2021 were cases of emotional and psychological abuse by intimate partners and/or family members. One of the NPA and partners’ observations regarding the camps was that in most cases the camps that are far from cities and that have less basic services, are in need of more focus in terms of case management and activities targeting in eliminating violence.

title.narrative: 1100- Strengthened civil society organizations are actively coordinating, protecting and promoting the rights and empowerment of conflict-affected women and girls (15+).
Baseline report
Number of women’s rights advocacy initiatives, led by conflict-affected women and girls, implemented by 3 partners in line with their joint Advocacy strategy.

description.narrative: The project's focus is grass root advocacy, which means that instead of NGOs staff leading and conducting advocacy, women and girls from the community will do so, with NGOs staff assisting them as needed. Partners have developed plans for grass root advocacy and approaching communities.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners who receive ‘sufficient’ scores in a quarterly Community Centre report card, after year 2 of the programme

description.narrative: To receive a sufficient score card the partners are expected to build active coordination mechanism and have plans on place to promote the rights of women and girls.

title.narrative: 1220- Conflict-affected women and girls (15+) are accessing confidential, alternative safe placements for the accommodation of SGBV survivors under threat.
2020 NPA baseline assessment report
% of women and girls 15+ who disclose life-threat receive confidential, alternative safe placements for a period of 1-10 months.

description.narrative: SGBV survivors do not normally choose to go to safe shelters for a variety of reasons, including (the shelter is not properly occupied with all necessities, women who are staying in the shelter are not allowed to go out, making them feel as if they are imprisoned in there), and till now, partners had not received any life-threatening cases that agreed to referral to a safe shelter.

title.narrative: 1114- Continuous training and coaching on MEAL and reporting is provided to the three partner CSO.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of individualized coaching sessions for CSO partners on MEAL and reporting.

description.narrative: During the reporting period MEAL team supported and provided guidance to the three CSO partners on using tools and reporting templates.

title.narrative: Number of CSO partners to receive training on MEAL

description.narrative: The CSO partners were trained in reporting and MEAL, with a focus on utilizing standardized reporting methods for the three of them, as well as how to utilize MEAL tools. During January and as part of MEAL team to train all partners, BWA staff were trained on basics of MEAL and tools, the same training will be provided to other partners during the second quarter of year 2022.

title.narrative: 1112- Continuous training and coaching on financial management is provided for project managers and finance staff from the three CSO partners.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors
Number of partners to receive training on financial management.

description.narrative: Since the beginning of the project, the partners have undergone several financial management trainings and coaching. Initially, the focus was on BWA as the project's new partner, in addition to offering coaching and mentorship to the other two partners. During the reporting period, NPA provided three partners with training on (anti corruption, vetting and procurement process).

title.narrative: Number of individualized coaching sessions for CSO partners on financial management.

description.narrative: The NPA finance team visited and gave many coaching sessions to HQ personnel and field staff of partners. The coaching sessions focused mostly on ( financial documentation, anti-corruption policies and tools, cash management, etc.). During the reporting period, the three partners received extensive and day to day coaching on finance.

title.narrative: 1122- Women's Community Centres and satellite safe spaces that have been established for confidential counselling and indoor recreation, and continue to operate in the four areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of Women’s Community Centres that are fully furnished, equipped, staffed and operational by the third Quarter of the programme.

description.narrative: Each partner has one center in one of their coverage areas. Emma had a community center in Duhok city covering the areas of (Duhok non-camp, Shariya non-camp, Darkar camp, Qadiya Camp and Akra non-camp), PDO has an operating community center in Khanke district covering the areas of (Khanke camp and non-camps, Bajid Kandala camp and Chammishko camp) and BWA opened a center in Mosul city covering east side of Mosul.

title.narrative: Number of satellite safe spaces that are established and operational

description.narrative: the CSO partners had already four satellite safe spaces and through coordination and assessment they are already working to find other satellite safe spaces for their activities.

title.narrative: 1231- Orientation Training on Code of Conduct, GBV Core Concepts, Effective PSS Sessions and Trauma Sensitivity is held for local activity leaders (e.g. volunteers, skilled facilitators) from the four operational areas.
Promoting Social and Economic Empowerment, Wellbeing, Dignity and Safety of Conflict-affected SGB Survivors_Dashboard
Number of Local Activity Leaders (e.g. volunteers, skilled facilitators) from 3 operational areas. to complete Orientation Training
